New Records: Corbin Carroll's inside-the-park home run was the seventh-fastest home-to-home time since Statcast tracking began in 2015
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a leadoff homer, Mookie Betts hit a homer two pitches later, Freddie Freeman hit a homer to give the Dodgers a 3-0 lead before an out was recorded

Corbin Carroll hit an inside-the-park home run, Jake McCarthy and Joc Pederson followed with singles, Lourdes Gurriel Jr. laced a two-run double and Eugenio Suárez plated Gurriel with a sac fly to give the D-backs a 4-3 lead
Tommy Edman's tiebreaking two-run single in the ninth gave the Dodgers a second straight win
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers and D-backs knew this weekend’s four-game tilt at Chase Field would set the tone for the NL West race down the stretch
Post-Match Reflections: D-backs manager Torey Lovullo said, 'That's one of the great qualities of this team -- their intensity, their focus, it never stops', 'And they were down 3-0 in the top of the first inning. The top of the first inning, with three home runs, it was almost unbelievable the way it happened. But it happened and we got back in the dugout and took care of our own business'
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said, 'Tonight was, man, a lot going on, a lot to unpack. A lot of grit, fight, from both teams. And those guys gave us all we could handle'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers and D-backs spelled it out for you right out of the gate that the NL West race was not for the faint of heart
The calendar will flip to September with Arizona (76-60) trailing Los Angeles (82-54) by six games, with two games left in this series and 26 games remaining for both clubs in the regular season
Even if the Dodgers hold on to make it 11 titles in the last 12 years, it’s clear there will be no runaway winner in the NL West this season
